content:
Partially Ordered Sets, Lattices etc. can be thought of as being defined on certain underlying Sets. In the classes of mathlib though, those structures are defined on certain Types.

How do I reason about simple Set theoretic operations (such as union, intersection etc.) on the underlying Sets of the Domain Theoretic structures when they are defined on Types instead of Sets?
(I apologize for the stupid question, I've been trying to understand how Lean works for a while now and I still feel very lost)

To take the union of orders, you use types such as docs#Sum and docs#Lex. Eg docs#Sum.Lex.partialOrder is the lexicographic sum of two orders. Intersection does not really make sense without an ambient type.

Yaël Dillies said:

To take the union of orders, you use types such as docs#Sum and docs#Lex. Eg docs#Sum.Lex.partialOrder is the lexicographic sum of two orders. Intersection does not really make sense without an ambient type.

Thank you very much!
George Kojonis has marked this topic as resolved.
